allOf.description: Start allocating ports at this value, going downward

primary-url.description: URL of the primary mariadb to replicate from

bootstrap-url.description: URL of a recent mariadb backup to bootstrap replication from

seconds-behind-master-threshold.description: Monitoring threshold for Seconds_Behind_Master in the replica, in seconds, -1 meaning no threshold

database-list.description: Databases to create and respective user credentials getting all privileges on it

full-retention-days.description: How many days full backups must be retained, -1 meaning full backups are disabled and 0 meaning no expiration

incremental-retention-days.description: How many days incremental backups (binlogs) must be retained, -1 meaning incremental backups are disabled and 0 meaning no expiration, defaulting to full-retention-days' value

backup-periodicity.description: When to backup, specified in the same format as for systemd.time(7) calendar events (years & seconds not supported, DoW & DoM can not be combined).

long-query-time.description: Number of seconds above which long queries are logged

max-connection-count.description: See MariaDB documentation on max_connections. If not provided, a value suitable for the number of request Zope processes is chosen.

relaxed-writes.description: When enabled, sets innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit = 0, innodb_flush_method = nosync, innodb_doublewrite = 0 and sync_frm = 0 - RTFM, those options are dangerous

ssl.description: Enable and define SSL support for network connections

ca-crt.description: Certificate Authority's certificate, in PEM format

crt.description: Server's certificate, in PEM format (mandatory to enable SSL support)

key.description: Server's key, in PEM format (mandatory to enable SSL support)

crl.description: Server's certificate revocation list, in PEM format

cipher.description: Permissible cipher specifications, separated by colons

odbc-ini.description: Contents of odbc.ini file, see unixodbc document

environment-variables.description: Extra environment variables for mysqld may be required to use third party ODBC libraries for CONNECT storage engine.
